title: Lanka T10: Indian team owner arrested over match-fixing
byline: An Indian national, who is the owner of the ‘Galle Marvels’ team in the Lanka T10 Super League, has been arrested by police over allegations of match-fixing.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, North-central and North-western provinces.

title: Six including minor killed in Tamil Nadu hospital fire
byline: At least six persons, including a minor boy, were killed in a fire accident at a private hospital in this district on Thursday, police and Fire department officials said.

title: Public urges to cooperate with ongoing population and housing census
byline: The District Secretary for Colombo, Prasanna Ginige, says that the population and housing census is underway across the island and urges the public to cooperate with the officials visiting homes by providing the required information.

title: High-level US delegation concludes successful visit to Sri Lanka
byline: U.S. Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asian Affairs at the Department of State, Ambassador Donald Lu, along with Deputy Assistant Secretary for Asia and the Pacific at the U.S. Department of the Treasury, Robert Kaproth...

title: Govt. aims to complete Colombo Port’s ECT Project by June 2025
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Rathnayake says that several new projects will be initiated to enhance the transportation of goods by rail.

title: Bottom trawling by Indian fishermen must stop: Sri Lanka’s Fisheries Minister
byline: The enduring fisheries conflict in the Palk Bay - which impacts fisher folk of northern Sri Lanka and daily wage fishermen of Tamil Nadu - can be decisively resolved only if the Indian side stops using the destructive bottomtrawling method, according to Sri Lanka’s Minister of Fisheries Ramalingam Chandrasekar.

title: Former Sri Lankan diplomat in Australia fined more than $100,000 for ‘entrapping’ domestic worker
byline: A diplomat who “entrapped” a domestic worker in her Canberra home, forcing her to work 14 hours, seven days a week, for less than a dollar an hour, has been fined more than $100,000 in the federal court.

title: Geminids meteor shower visible from Sri Lanka tonight
byline: The Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies (ACCIMT) says that the Geminids meteor shower, considered as one of the most spectacular meteor showers of the year, will be visible tonight (13) and tomorrow (14).

title: ‘Offenders will face consequences, regardless of rank or status’ – President AKD
byline: “We will not allow the trust the people have placed in us to be undermined in any way,” stated President Anura Kumara Dissanayake during a meeting with the heads of state media today (13).

title: FIB probes presidential candidates who failed to submit expense reports
byline: The Fraud Investigation Bureau (FIB) has informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (13) that it has initiated an investigation into several candidates that contested the last Presidential Election and their representatives who have failed to submit proper expense reports as mandated under the Regulation of Election Expenditure Act.

title: Canada reaffirms support for Sri Lanka’s anti-corruption efforts
byline: The Canadian Government has expressed its strong commitment to supporting Sri Lanka’s initiatives to combat corruption and fraud, the President’s Media Division (PMD) reported.

title: Indian team owner arrested over Lanka T10 match-fixing scandal remanded
byline: The Indian owner of the ‘Galle Marvels’ team in the Lanka T10 Super League, who was arrested yesterday (12) over match-fixing allegations, has been remanded until December 16 after being produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (13).

title: Sri Lanka says Adani Port Project to continue despite US charges
byline: Indian conglomerate Adani Group’s port project in Sri Lanka will go ahead despite US charges against its founder and sudden changes to its financing, the island nation said Friday.

title: SJB MPs sign no-confidence motion against Speaker
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) parliamentary group, led by Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa, has commenced signing the Motion of No Confidence against the Speaker of Parliament, according to the SJB Media Unit.

title: Indian actor Allu Arjun arrested over woman’s death during film premiere stampede
byline: The Hyderabad police on Friday arrested Tollywood ‘Icon star’ Allu Arjun in connection with the tragic death of a woman during a stampede at the Sandhya Theatre.

title: Members appointed to Port City Economic Commission
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has officially appointed members to the Port City Economic Commission, the President’s Media Division (PMD) reported.

title: CSE’s ASPI records new all-time high
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange gained 169.53 points to close at 14,205.34 points today, marking a new all-time high.

title: Six including elderly couple arrested with drugs worth around Rs. 40 mln
byline: Kahathuduwa Police have arrested six individuals, including an elderly couple, with a stock of narcotics worth around Rs. 40 million.

title: Former CCD Director further remanded
byline: Former Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) Director, Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Nevil Silva, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), has been further remanded until December 20 by the Ratnapura Magistrate’s Court.

title: Proposal to appoint select committee to verify NPP MPs’ educational qualifications
byline: The United National Party (UNP) and the New Democratic Front (NDF) have decided to submit a proposal recommending to establish a Select Committee to verify the educational qualifications of the Ministers and MPs representing the National People’s Power (NPP).

title: President Dissanayake to visit India on Sunday
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will undertake a state visit to India from 15 to 17 December 2024 at the invitation of the President of India, Smt. Droupadi Murmu, the foreign ministry confirmed today.

title: Asoka Ranwala resigns as Speaker of Parliament
byline: The Speaker of Sri Lanka’s Parliament Asoka Ranwala has resigned from his position, in the wake of the controversy surrounding his educational qualifications.

title: Shots fired at residence of ‘Konda Ranji’
byline: Two unidentified individuals who had arrived on a motorcycle have reportedly opened fire at a three-storey house located on Veedi Mawatha in Kandana.

title: Macron names François Bayrou as French PM after government collapse
byline: French President Emmanuel Macron named key ally Francois Bayrou as his fourth prime minister of 2024 on Friday, but the scale of the challenge facing the veteran centrist was immediately clear as the Socialist Party refused to join his coalition government.

title: Sri Lanka sees strong bondholder support in debt exchange
byline: Sri Lanka gained extensive support from private creditors to restructure its international bonds, a key step for the country to exit an extended default.

title: Sri Lanka successfully concluded international bond restructuring – Treasury Secretary
byline: Sri Lanka has successfully concluded its international bond restructuring, bringing closure to one of the most complex and challenging sovereign debt restructuring exercises in recent history, says Treasury Secretary Mahinda Siriwardana.
